alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 3:58PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Belmont, Guernsey, Monroe and Noble. Portions of Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Fayette, Greene, Indiana, Washington and Westmoreland. Portions of West Virginia, including the following counties, Marion, Marshall, Monongalia, Ohio, Preston and Wetzel. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 354 PM EST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain and snowmelt causing elevated levels on streams and creeks. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morgantown, Wheeling, Greensburg, Fairmont, Washington, Cambridge, Uniontown, Jeannette, Moundsville, Latrobe, Connellsville, Martins Ferry, New Martinsville, St. Clairsville, Bellaire, Barnesville, Waynesburg, Westover, Warwood and Bethlehem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
